verses.roman:
skandaḥ pradyumna-bāṇaughair
ardyamānaḥ samantataḥ
asṛg vimuñcan gātrebhyaḥ
śikhināpakramad raṇāt

synonyms: skandaḥ—Kārtikeya; pradyumna-bāṇa—of Pradyumna's arrows; oghaiḥ—by the torrents; ardyamānaḥ—distressed; samantataḥ—on all sides; asṛk—blood; vimuñcan—exuding; gātrebhyaḥ—from his limbs; śikhinā—on his peacock carrier; apākramat—went away; raṇāt—from the battlefield.
translation: Lord Kārtikeya was distressed by the flood of Pradyumna's arrows raining down from all sides, and thus he fled the battlefield on his peacock as blood poured from his limbs.
